poem:
Craft of Illusions  

In the broken city's heart,  
where whispers trade in shadows,  
lies spun like threads,  
deceit dances with charm.  

A coin flips,  
minds suspend disbelief—  
characters weave, footsteps unsteady.  

Oh, cunning dance,  
where even the viewers lean,  
feeling the sway,  
beneath their feet, a world remade.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Nine Queens review – Fabián Bielinsky’s brilliant grifter classic offers masterclass in double dealing Twenty-five years ago, Argentinian director Fabián Bielinsky gave us this grifter satire classic, a deliciously cynical tale of swindling and double-cross. It is confidence trickery perpetrated on the victim in parallel to narrative trickery perpetrated on the audience, who are invited to assume that however hard the fictional characters on screen are falling, the rug under their own feet is perfectly". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
